reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While centrally located in the Tsim Sha Tsui area of Kowloon, and presenting a pretty public face, the aging mechanical and electrical systems (read internet connection, plumbing and air-conditioning) reveal themselves in many uncomfortable ways.
reviews.title: Barely adequate for its rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a standard room with twin beds and were initially impressed with the way the interior designers had shoe-horned every necessity in the typically tiny space, A lot of translucent glass (including the door to the bathroom) was involved in giving guests an illusion of space. However, that could not disguise the extra-narrow luggage shelf (don't even think of bringing anything but carry-on size) nor make-up for the lack of a simple eye-level ledge (in the petite shower stall) for holding shampoo/bath gel etc. One had to stoop to the floor to use these items.
reviews.title: Great base for HK shopping

reviews.text: My techie husband immediately complained about the "antiquated" internet connection. I was more concerned by the unresponsive air-conditioning controls---the temperature indicator stubbornly displayed 22 degrees C even after repeated attempts to change it to a more reasonable 25C. The beds sagged.
reviews.title: I always end up at the Empire Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second day (of our three-day stay), the toilet flush mechanism failed and was not attended to after a four-hour interval. The staff offered us a new room (after 10:00 p.m.) and sent a porter to help us move. The identically sized new chamber had other problems, however. The internet connection somehow would not connect---but kudos to the desk staffer who came up to the room and did something to make it work---although this took up almost an hour. (They did not charge us for the last two days of internet.) The air-conditioning was again rather slow to change temperatures, and the beds sagged even more uncomfortably.
reviews.title: good location to experience hong kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side---the rooms were kept clean (although one morning they failed to wash our used tea cups) and the sound-proofing was good---no traffic noise from outside, no sound leaks from adjoining rooms. Also, the corridors were covered in cheerful, geometrically patterned carpeting.
reviews.title: A MAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only advantage this hotel has is it's site. Very close to Nathan Rd and only 12mins walk to the waterfront. Also beautiful gardens up the steps across Nathan Rd from the end of Courtney Rd. There is a very nice Lane with a range of excellent international food places within 70metres.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: I would rate the Empire as barely 3 star. The room was small and needs a complete upgrade. The air-con that didn't work was so noisy we couldn't sleep with it. I called the maintenance man who explained that it was very old and took a long time to work. NO. After the second day the shifted us to a top floor room that had air-con and was marginally larger but almost as noisy and with an air freshener didn't smell too bad..
reviews.title: Disappointing for the price

reviews.text: There was no warmth or feeling from the staff and the only staff member who spoke to us was a young Bell Boy and he was friendly and smiley on the days he was working. There are other Hotels close by that other tourists said they enjoyed.
reviews.title: great bed, decent location

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights while on a mini-break. I have to say that for the price ($200/night) it was a disappointment. We had 2 twin beds that were probably actually smaller than twin beds. We barely had enough room to walk once we put our luggage down. The room had a "wiped down" look to it, and I could tell from the water stains on the sink counter that only the bare minimum had been done to clean it. The rugs look like they have not been cleaned for years, and the entire hallway and elevator area smelled like damp mold. The sheets were thin and so were the blankets. The beds were hard as a rock. I also got temporarily locked in the bathroom because the lock on the door was installed wrong and the screw fell out! Good thing I was traveling with Mr Fix-it!
reviews.title: Great hotel in an okay location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have Wi-Fi but you have to pay for it--I believe it was about $18 USD for one 24 hour period of usage. I had to ask several times for them to connect me because their website was not working.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way back from India. This htel provided all the luxury and relaxing environment you'd need! I'd highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Restful stop in a crazy town!

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on a staff incentive trip. When first stepped into the room, noticed that it was very small though the level we stayed were in the Empire Club level. The closet provided hardly can fit in all my clothes, the depth is less than 10 cm.
reviews.title: Small room though very big television

reviews.text: However, the only thing that attracted my attention is that the TV is so large that when I laid on my bed, I found that it was too big that I need to turn my head slightly to catch the running lines on the news.
reviews.title: Clean and average decorated but not near to MTR

reviews.text: Room services is only available from 0600 hrs to 2330 hrs. Internet cost HK$40/hr or HK$120/day.
reviews.title: nice room...not so nice smell

reviews.text: Staff were relatively indifferent at times, perhaps due to the large number of guests during this summer period where sales are abundant.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got the HK in the middle of convention week so everything was much more expensive than usual, including the Empire, but its a solid performer despite some issues with our arrival. We had a blocked toilet and difficulty communicating that to satff. Got it fixed but took a while. Good room and bed. The pool is in a weird place at the bottom of a highrise void through the building but we needed it and it did its job. Free Airport Shuttle to Kowloon Railway Station (to connect to airport trian) at the front door.
reviews.title: Nice for a nice price

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here two nights. The a/c was not working properly in our room so it never got cooler than 25 degrees Celsius. I complained after the first day and they said they would send someone to fix it and if not fixed we could switch rooms. That was before we went out for the day to spend some time in Hong Kong. We returned to find out no one even looked at the room at which point I complained they said they would send someone "right up". I waited for a half hour that I could have been taking a shower for a person who never showed up. I then called the front desk and told them plain and simple I would like to switch rooms. Then they were prompts and sent up someone to help take our luggage to another room. The hotel appears to be quite nice on the inside but has some service issues. My husband had stayed here in the past and said he will not return now...he was giving it a second chance after some service issues the time before.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, service issues

reviews.text: This hotel doesn't have the amenities of the more luxurious hotels but has all the needs necessary for a comfortable stay. It is very well located, in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, near the Victoria Harbour and near Nathan Road and Canton Road.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel e well located

reviews.text: If you like the busy area of Kowloon, it is a very good location right in the middle.
reviews.title: Good Hotel at very good location in Kowloon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nathan Road and the piers are just around the corner in walking distance.
reviews.title: good location......just nice room
